column5: Our MSc gives you an in-depth understanding of geotechnical engineering. It covers topics associated with:the engineering behaviour of soils and rocksgeotechnical designsite investigation and testingconstruction practiceAdvanced geotechnical specialisms are also taught. These include the application of state-of-the art computational tools in design and the engineering of specialist earth structures such as tailing dams.Our Geotechnical Engineering master's is for both practising professionals and new graduates in:
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, up to 4 years part time
